com.ericdaugherty.lib.configuration
Class FileSource

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ericdaugherty.lib.configuration.FileSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigurationSource
Direct Known Subclasses:
PropertyFileSource
public abstract class FileSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements ConfigurationSource

Abstract class that provides common functionality for all sources that load configuration information from a file.

Classes that extends this class must provide implementations of the the ConfigurationSource interface methods. Also, if the implementation wishes to utilize to FileWatcher thread, it must call startWatcher() in it's initialize() method.

Author:
Eric Daugherty (http://www.ericdaugherty.com/java/daughertylib)

FileSource

Method Detail

initialize

public void initialize(ConfigurationService service,
                       java.util.Properties properties)
                throws ConfigurationException
Allows the ConfigurationSource implementation to be passed parameters from an external class. This allows ConfigurationSources to be initialized from a configuration source instead of programmatically.

All ConfigurationSource implementations should have a default (no parameter) constructor.

Specified by:
initialize in interface ConfigurationSource
Parameters:
service - reference to the default or named singleton instance of the ConfigurationService
properties - instance containing any source specific configuration parameters.
Throws:
ConfigurationException - thrown if the source cannot successfully be initialized with the provided parameters.

setFileName

public void setFileName(java.lang.String fileName)
Sets the file name to use to open the configuration file. This setting does not take affect until the initialize method is called.
Parameters:
fileName - name (and path) of the file to load.

setRefreshSeconds

public void setRefreshSeconds(long refreshSeconds)
Sets the number of seconds the FileWatcher thread should wait between checks of the configuration file.

Changes to this parameter will not take affect unless the thread is stoped and restarted.

This value can be set to -1 to disable the automatic reloading.

Parameters:
refreshSeconds - the number of seconds to wait between checks of the configuration file.

startWatcher

public void startWatcher()
Starts the thread that watches the properties file for changes, if it is not already running.

stopWatcher

public void stopWatcher()
Stops the thread that is watching the configuration file for changes.
